content.title: My Projects
description: Here you'll find some of the projects I've been working on independently, things for fun and a willingness to experiment algorithms with focus for simulations and virtual games.
You can try out the prototypes through the 'Live demo' button, or if you want, view the source code through the 'Source code' button to open the hood of the machines and see how they work.
Keep in mind that every software shown in this site are prototypes, they come without any warranty of functioning. every project have a GPLv3 license.

items.name: Terrain Generator
items.description:
The Terrain Generator is a tech demo, created to show the capabilites of procedural generation algorithms such as perlin noises to create a terrain simulation. With this, we can create some interesting landscapes with mountains, lakes, beaches and plains. The application offers all range of tools to customize the landscape as you wish, not only the terrain, but also the ambient around.

Everything is rendered with graphics acceleration, giving the best performance for desktops and mobile phones, directly from the web browser.

items.name: Icosphere
items.description:
The Icosphere Game Library is a high-performance cross-platform 2D/3D game creation library with support for hardware acceleration. With a simplified architecture written in C/C++, it allows you to easily compile games for both desktop and web browsers natively. Including smartphones, tablets, consoles and Windows, Linux and macOS computers and Chrome, Firefox and Safari browsers.

The entire specification of the library can be found in the documentation available through the link below. With introduction, system overview, architecture, examples and reference material.

Access the documentation here

items.name: Perceptron
items.description:
The perceptron is one of the first algorithms created to simulate the behavior of human neurons. Originally created by Frank Rosenblatt in 1958.

Once trained in a supervised manner, the AI is capable of differentiating symbols and/or drawnings and group into two distinct groups. The drawings are captured on a retina system, and the light intensity is measured in each cell, each one keeps a memory of what was seen, and based on its memories it identifies shapes and classifies them in a binary way.

Read more about it

Watch more about it

items.name: Open Flappy
items.description:
A recreation from a famous game, Flappy Bird. Running directcly on your web browser, built to work on your cellphone or your computer.

Credits to zapsplat.com for the sound effects and Peleila@opengameart.org for the art.

items.name: KanbanWeb
items.description:
A open source application for organizing projects based on the Kanban model.
It has support for saving on browser, export to your device, responsive interface for mobile and desktop and dynamic theme.

items.name: PaintSpace
items.description: This single page application allow the possibility to create drawnings, paintings, edit images, play with geometrical forms, mess with the color pallete and much more, everything is simple and straight to the point Try now and unleash your creativity.

items.name: Falling Blocks
items.description: A simple, but more complex implementation of a game written in C with help of OpenGL. Basically consists of a mechanic where the player needs to dodge falling objects, the more objects the player avoids, the more points he earns.

items.name: Mandelbrot Experiment
items.description:
The experiment of Mandelbrot set creates an very interesting and extremly complex image by doing some math and drawing the result on the cartesian plane.

You can learn more about fractals on this article on Wikipedia.

WARNING: keep in mind that the rendering demands time and power from your computer, the page can be unresponsive for a couple of time, usually some seconds.

items.name: SnakeGame
items.description: A very simple old game, but recreated with the help of C language combined with OpenGL, no engines were used, the objective is very clear, eat as more as you can, without touching anything else.

items.name: AtomBiosEditor
items.description: A graphics card firmware editor, making possible to perform extreme overclocks on the board, focused on editing AMD GPU's BIOS released between 2011 and 2015, works only on macOS system.

items.name: CRXDownloader
items.description: A simple tool to download the source code of Chrome extensions in a practical way, thus allowing the analysis of possible unwanted or malicious codes or being able to load them in other browsers based on Chromium.

items.name: Andromeda Project
items.description: One of the first tries to develop a working game, it turns out to be a complete mess in his final stages of development, it doesn't even have an appropriate name, but it has a codename Andromeda.
